references.paper_title: A fully integrated wearable ultrasound system to monitor deep tissues in moving subjects
references.reason: This paper is a foundational work for the application of deep neural networks in real-time human health monitoring, which is highly relevant to TinyTTA's focus on resource-constrained edge devices for real-time applications.

references.paper_title: Deep learning in robotics: Survey on model structures and training strategies
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of deep learning techniques in robotics and their training, which is important for the context of TinyTTA's use of deep neural networks in resource-constrained environments for robotics applications.

references.paper_title: Towards stable test-time adaptation in dynamic wild world
references.reason: This paper addresses the challenge of continuous adaptation of models in changing environments, which is the core problem that TinyTTA aims to solve, thereby improving the accuracy of the model when there are distribution shifts.

references.paper_title: Robustbench: a standardized adversarial robustness benchmark
references.reason: This paper introduces a standardized benchmark for evaluating the robustness of deep neural networks against adversarial attacks, which is essential for TinyTTA's goal of developing robust and efficient TTA frameworks that can handle various distribution shifts.
